ygData.subject: RE: Cazic Thule slain on Innoruuk.
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree. The only time I do not get along with another bard is usually when one of the powergamers create a bard twink (Ykeesha, All the best non planes, non
ygData.messageBody:
I agree.
The only time I do not get along with another bard is usually when one of
the powergamers create a bard twink (Ykeesha, All the best non planes, non
no drop equipment) and spend time Training the group I am in because they
bite off more than they can chew. hopefully, they don't play that bard long.
They also cannot seem to play more than one song at a time;)

-Martyn
Mithaniel Marr



-----Original Message-----
From: Ryan Honeyman [mailto:honeyman@...]
Sent: Tuesday, January 04, 2000 12:32 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Cazic Thule slain on Innoruuk.


From: Ryan Honeyman <honeyman@...>



> (I know all but one of them and they also are very friendly and cool).
I'm

> still hoping to be one of the first 10 bards to reach 50 there on Prexus

> :-).



Schweet Taneran.



All the bards I know are good people. It's odd. Bards really

stick together more so than any other class I've seen. It could

be the friendly group mentality we have. A bard is truly a

different beast.



I noticed that a L50 cleric was trying to powerlevel a bard

the other day. Needless to say, I've seen very few bards

powerleveled. It's not an easy thing to do. Most powergamers

cannot stand being so weak, because in their mind if you cannot

heal, melee, or nuke then you are no good. The inherent bard

trait is to group, and to powergame you cannot do such.

Therefore you build this community of very intelligent, patient,

fun, and likable people. I've never seen two bards really hate

each other like I've seen wizards hate wizards, and druids hate

druids.



I love bards.



Harm.




Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.
